meanings.definition: A unit of luminance equal to one thousandth of a lambert.
meanings.sent1: The room was lit with just a few millilamberts, creating a cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: The scientist measured the millilamberts emitted by the light bulb.
meanings.sent3: The millilamberts in the night sky seemed to twinkle like tiny stars.
meanings.sent4: Her smile radiated millilamberts of happiness, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The millilamberts from the fireflies painted a magical scene in the garden.

meanings.definition: A measurement used in photometry to quantify the brightness of a light source.
meanings.sent1: The digital display showed the millilamberts of the screen, indicating its brightness level.
meanings.sent2: Photographers often adjust their camera settings based on the millilamberts of the environment.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the brightest costume reached new heights with millilamberts as the judging criteria.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline glowed with millilamberts as the sun set behind the buildings.
meanings.sent5: The theater stage was flooded with millilamberts, setting the perfect mood for the performance.
